description.narrative: The Project is expected to increase access to quality mobile connectivity through the expansion of capacity and coverage of high-speed mobile network in target countries with gaps in access to quality mobile connectivity. These outcomes have the potential to result in enhanced GDP growth and employment in the target countries by enabling efficiencies, innovation and inclusion across their economies. The project is also expected to increase overall mobile market competitiveness by funding and thereby enabling further technological innovation or improvement in affordability of high-speed mobile Internet.

The proposed investment comprises up to US$150 million from IFCs own account and up to US$44 million in mobilization from Managed Co-Lending Portfolio Program (MCPP) to support Airtel Africas network investment across 7 subsidiaries as well as refinancing its existing loans. The project component for Airtel Zambia is expected to be supported by the International Development Associations Private Sector Window Local Currency Facility (IDA-19 PSW LCF) as described in the Blended Finance Section.
